Authors: Caleb A. Morse, Theodore L Esslinger, Steve Leavitt
Title:
A new North American Species in the lichen genus
Hyperphyscia.
Keywords:
Ascomycota, Lecanoromycetes, Physciaceae, North America,
Great Plains
Abstract:
In North America, the widespread sorediate lichen known as
Hyperphyscia adglutinata is shown to be heterogeneous. It contains two
distinct species, one with primarily laminal soralia and another
distinguished by its characteristic marginal soralia. The latter taxon
is here described as the new species H. confusa. Hyperphyscia
adglutinata and H. confusa have broadly overlapping distributions in
North America, especially in the Midwest and Great Plains states. Where
the two are sympatric, H. confusa is generally the more common of the
two. Descriptions and discussions for H. adglutinata and the two other
sorediate North American species, H. minor and H. pyrithrocardia, are
also included, along with a key for separation of the four species.
Hyperphyscia pyrithrocardia is reported for the first time from North
America.
